citation.article-title: Aureispira marina gen. nov., sp. nov., a gliding, arachidonic acid-containing bacterium isolated from the southern coastline of Thailand.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Aureispira (Au.re.i.spi′ra. L. adj. aureus golden; L. n. spira a spiral; N.L. fem. n. Aureispira golden spiral).
Unbranched; cells are 0.8–1.2×1.5–2.5 μm, forming flexible helical filaments up to 100 μm long.
Helix width is 1.5–2.0 μm; helix pitch is 4–9 μm (Fig. 2).
Positive for cytochrome oxidase, catalase, alkaline phosphatase and acid phosphatase.
The predominant fatty acid is 20 : 4ω6c (arachidonic acid); other characteristic fatty acids are 16 : 0 and iso-17 : 0.
The genus belongs to the family ‘Saprospiraceae’ in the phylum Bacteroidetes.
The type species is Aureispira marina.
